meanings.definition: To make greater in power, influence, or reputation.
meanings.sent1: She tried to aggrandize her role in the school play by telling everyone she was the lead actress.
meanings.sent2: Politicians often aggrandize their accomplishments to gain more votes.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to aggrandize its size by puffing up its fur when it saw a dog approaching.
meanings.sent4: The artist aggrandized the beauty of the landscape by adding vibrant colors to the painting.
meanings.sent5: The CEO's speech was full of grandiose language to aggrandize his company's success.

meanings.sent1: The magician used mirrors to aggrandize the size of the rabbit in the hat.
meanings.sent2: The marketing team aggrandized the benefits of the new product in their advertisement.
meanings.sent3: The chef tried to aggrandize the portion size of the dish by using a smaller plate.
meanings.sent4: The author aggrandized the importance of the minor character by giving them a heroic backstory.
meanings.sent5: The photographer used lighting techniques to aggrandize the beauty of the model in the photo shoot.
